You should change the text of the online help (please note the spelling mistake in Not i fications) from: Email Notfications of Feedback Submissions On the submission of a Feedback response, administrators will receive email notification. to Email Not i fications of Feedback Submissions On the submission of a Feedback response, teachers will receive email notification. Joseph
Comment 4: Using Moodle 1.9.3 and administrators do not receive an email when feedback is submitted. Please look into this, or at least list some things for me to verify that it's working properly.
Comment 5: Andreas Does this notification happen at a site or course level?  I am in a situation where I need to send notifications to the teacher and their supervisor.  So If I understand correctly I would set the supervisor as a teacher in the same course so they would recieve the notifications. How does this work if there are several sections of the same course taught daily or weekly with different teachers, would all teachers get the notification or just the current ones? Scott Karren
Comment 6: Hi Scott, you can try the following. Override the role editingteacher for this course and disallow the "receivemail" permission . Go into each feedback-instance of this course and assign the teachers, who should get the mail of this feedback. Override the role editingteacher for these feedbacks and allow the "reseivemail" permission I'm hoping, it is what you mean. Andreas
Comment 7: Hi Andreas! Go into each feedback-instance of this course and assign the teachers, who should get the mail of this feedback. I couldn´t find any place where I could choose who gets and who doesn´t get the mails. Where is it to be found? I use 1.9.4 thanks. christophe
Comment 8: My email notification seemed to work without me trying, I have Moodle 1.8.3 and it appear to send it to anyone registered as a course creator or admin at a site and course level
Comment 9: I have the feedback on the frontpage. It doesn't send emails. I need the emails to go to the admin email as this is also the state contact for our group. I have Front Page Roles set with admin as teacher. The feedback itself doesn't have the admin listed as an option for locally assigned role of teacher. I can't change the email address of the admin. This is a foundational email to our entire organization. What else do I need to do to make this activity work? I am trying to find a way for guests to send a message to the admin that will generate an email notification to the admin without guests actually having to write an email. I thought Contact Form block would work, but I can't get that block to work for guests. I thought Questionnaire, but it doesn't work for guests. Finally, I'm trying feedback per Mary Cooch. It won't send emails. I don't know what else to do. If guests can't contact us from the site, we may as well not have a site. Suggestions? This makes 2 wks working on this. I'm catching heat from above now.
Comment 10: I GOT IT! I GOT IT! I solved both problems at once by upgrading from 1.9.2 to 1.9.3 AND upgrading the questionnaire to 1.9. This fixed the width issue with the theme/layout and gave me guest access to questionnaire thus generating an email to admin without actually having guest write an email. Lesson learned: stay on top of those upgrades!
Comment 11: Hi, be sure the following things has been set. all users who should get an email are assigned to an role on the frontpage. If you don't want the users have any rights to edit some things on frontpage you can assign the users to the role "guest". Now you can assign these users to the role teacher or editingteacher locally on the feedback. You also can create an own role for example "feedbackemailuser". On this role you set the capability "Receive email notification" to "Allow". After this you can assign all users which should receive an email to this role on the frontpage or locally on the feedback. Now the wanted users should receive an email. Andreas
Comment 12: Hi, I am working with Moodle 1.9.3 and Feedback and Questionnaire modules. Both modules work right, but neither of them send mail notifications. In Feedback module case, I always check the option 'Send e-mail notifications'. But in this case, once I've answered the questionnaire, I got "ERROR: Could not instantiate mail function. " message. Anyone solved this situation? Thanks in advance.
Comment 13: David, If neither of these two modules sends e-mail notifications then there is probably something wrong with your moodle site's e-mail settings, not with the modules themselves. Is you moodle site on the Internet or on a local machine? Joseph
Comment 14: Ok Joseph, you are right. I have moodle on a local machine, although it access Internet, I think I configured Moodle tu run only in local mode. I'll have a look. thanks!
Comment 15: Normally a local installation of Moodle does not send out any e-mail messages, forum messages, etc. It is possible but rather complicated to make it work. You could post the question in the General Problems forum. Joseph
Comment 16: Hi Joseph, now I got it working. Anyway something weird happens. Comments associated with the post:

Comment 7: Hi Stan, you have to switch the role-settings for the special instance of your feedback in your course. Go to the feedback and click "Update this Feedback". Click "Override permissions" (on the tab-row above) Click on the editingteacher role Select "Allow" on the first row "Complete a feedback" Select "Prevent" on the row "Edit items" Now only teachers can see this feedback, because it is hidden and they can fill out this feedback because the permissions are changed. Andreas

Comment 9: Hi Stan, did you test it as admin or as teacher? The settings will only work for teachers. Andreas

Forum Post: 
Post title: Feedback: can I recover from this disaster?
Post description: I guess I used the wrong tool for the task but it occurred to me that I could use Feedback to collect data about our students submissions of their final projects but this has become a little nightmare. The idea was simple and I don't know why it shouldn't work. I created a little survey where the students had to introduce (as the answer to different questions) their first name, their last name, the name of their project and the name of the project supervisor. I thought this would save us a lot of time since we would not have to write the title of each student's project in a spreadsheet. The first problem I encountered is the organization of the data. This is my fault because I didn't check how Feedback would output the results into a spreadsheet. I thought that I could export the data into a spreadsheet in the following format: Last Name First Name Project's name Project supervisor Smith Axel How to build a... Peter Brown Seifert Nina Analysis of... Principles of Dana Peterson Peter Brown But Feedback exports the data like this: Last Name Smith Seifert García First Name Axel Nina María .... ---------- Well, that's not the real problem. I thought I would simply cut the columns for the different sections and paste them next to each other to achieve the desired format (as in the table above). I was horrified, however, when I saw that the columns are not ordered! So for instance, I would get: Last Name García Seifert Smith First Name Axel María Nina Project's name Analysis Principles of How to build a.. Project supervisor Peter Brown Peter Brown Dana Peterson So when I paste the different columns next to each other I get things totally mixed up: the Last Name from one person, the First Name from another, the title of the project from a different person, etc. What on earth is going on? I can understand that Feedback will organize the results as a single column instead of rows and columns. But why doesn't each column follow the same order? (where each position in the column for each category or question corresponds to the answer given by the same person) This doesn't make sense. The order of the column for each category seems to be totally random. I have more than 100 entries! Does this mean that I will have to access each answer through 'show responses' and add all the data by hand in a spreadsheet? Please tell me that this is not so. Is there anyway out of this mess?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Josep, have a look at the excel-export. There is a second worksheet called "detailed". There you will find the data as you described. Each row stands for one submit. Andreas
Comment 2: Thanks a lot, Andreas.

Post title: Feedback 1.9 fails to remove slashes when editing questions
Post description: When you edit a question in Feedback under Moodle 1.9, the backslashes used to escape quotes and apostrophes in the database are not being stripped out by the module. As a result, the slashes show up when you're editing the question, and are saved to the database when you save the question. To recreate the problem: 1. Create a Feedback. 2. Add a question with a quote or apostrophe in it. 3. Save the question. 4. Edit the question. The backslash should appear. 5. Save the question. The backslash is saved to the database. I added a report and proposed patch to tracker for this problem: http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-15331
Comments associated with the post:

Post title: Feedback: adding identification to feedback
Post description: I've been using the feedback module for a small questionnaire, combined with a quiz (as testing-tool). The target is to export both results to Excel document and then compare both results with statistical software (SPSS). To accomplish this, both results need to be identified by a username. The problem is that the quiz does give some identification when exporting to Excel, but the Feedback module does not export an ID to Excel: The “analysis page” shows a generalized result without ID (as is the exported Excel document). The “input page” does show details (with ID), but does not have an Excel export option. Is it possible to add an identification to the exported Excel document? Thomas Coppens
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Thomas, have a look at the excel workbook. There are two worksheets. The second one is with detailed informations.
Comment 2: Hello Andreas Thank you for taking time to answer my question. I've taken a look at the second worksheet as you suggested, but I can't find an identification in the detailed worksheet. I think something might be going wrong with the feedback.xls creation? Could you take a quick look at the Excel document? I've put it here . Thomas Coppens
Comment 3: Hi Thomas, do you use the last version of feedback? What version is shown in your admin-panel? Andreas
Comment 4: Andreas I'm currently using Feedback version 2008050104 and Moodle version 1.9. Do you need some extra information? Sincerely Thomas Coppens
Comment 5: Andreas Some more information about the configuration: - OS: FreeBSD version 6.2 - Webserver software: Apache version 1.3.37 with PHP version 5.2.4 Thomas Coppens
Comment 6: Hi Thomas, ok, can you try to export with debugging is set on? Note, please set the debugging to "All:..." not to "Developer:..."! If the export file is wrong so you can open it in an editor. Perhaps there you can find some error outputs. Also check if there is support for iconv or mbstring in your php. Andreas
Comment 7: I have not had any issues with this.
Comment 8: Hello Andreas I'm waiting for an information from the hosting company about iconv and mbstring support. Debugging has been enabled, and I've also added myself as administrator to the site. Added an attachment to this post including the page with errors whenever the export function to Excel is used. This page does look abnormal, but I can't make any conclussion on what's causing this behavior. Does it say more to you? Also, a message saying " Notice : Undefined variable: return in /usr/home/deb4871/domains/ceupers.be/public_html/nursing/mod/feedback/lib.php on line 147" appears whenever viewing the activity report in a user profile.
Comment 9: Hello again Andreas The Moodle administration page (environment) says iconv and mbstring are supported. I've reinstalled Moodle using version 1.9.1 with Feedback version 2008050105 but the issue isn't resolved. The questionnaire for the thesis is running, so I hope to recover the results next month. Do you think this issue can be solved? Regards Thomas Coppens
Comment 10: Hi Thomas, you can try two things. first: switch the configuration for the excel encoding to latin. You can do that on "Site Administration" -> "Language" -> "Language settings". There you will find this option at the bottom of this page. If this still isn't working so you can try the second one: Open the file "easy_excel.php" from feedback-folder with an simple text-editor (not Word or OpenOffice!) Go at the bottom of this file. You will find the function "feedback_convert_to_win()". It should look like this: function feedback_convert_to_win($text) { global $CFG; static $textlib; static $newwincharset; static $oldcharset; if(!isset($textlib)) { $textlib = textlib_get_instance(); } ... Put directly below the line "function feedback_convert_to_win($text) {" the statement: "return $text;" It now should look like this: function feedback_convert_to_win($text) { return $text; global $CFG; static $textlib; static $newwincharset; static $oldcharset; if(!isset($textlib)) { $textlib = textlib_get_instance(); } ... I'm hoping it helps. Andreas
Comment 11: Andreas Your suggestion did help. Switching the Excel encoding language to Latin (using Moodle "Site Administration", "Language", "Settings", "Excel encoding") did the trick. I very much appreciate all the time you've devoted to this... thanks! Thomas Coppens

Forum Post: 
Post title: Installation 'Error'
Post description: Hi, I was trying to install this plugin on my local copy of moodle 1.8 and I consistantly get the following error: Upgrade already running in this session, please wait! Click on the exclamation marks to ignore this warning ( !!! ). ( Continue ) I have tried all sorts but it doesn't help - it just keeps refreshing forever. If I click the exclamation marks it prooceeds but then when I add some questions then log in as a student - upon submitting my answers I simply get the red error box with the helpful message 'error' has anyone else experienced this? regards Alex
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Alex, it is important to use the right feedback-module for the related moodle-version. You should clean up your system and new install the feedback-module. Go into the "Site Administration" -> "Modules" -> "Activities" -> "Manage activities" and delete the feedback-module (note: all existing feedbacks on installed courses will be deleted) After that you should look at the database whether there still are some feedback-tables. If it is so you can drop all tables which start with mdl_feedback.... At the end do a new install with the correct feedback version. Andreas

Forum Post: 
Post title: Feedback importing & exporting questions
Post description: Hi Everyone, I running on Moodle 1.6.6+ with the feedback module installed. The only problem I have, is that I can't import/export questions as xml . There was no import.php file in the /mod/ feedback / directory. Do I get this from somewhere else? I have seen it documented elsewhere. But I don't any options for importing and exporting. Can you import/export on 1.6.6? TIA Kind Regards Darrel
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Darrel, the ex-/import from/to xml is available up to feedback for moodle 1.7. Nevertheless you can save your feedback into a public template so you will be able to use it on other courses. Also you can backup your course with only feedback included and then restore this backup on another installation.
Comment 2: I'm running Moodle 1.8.2+ (2007021520), and feedback module version 2007070701 . I want to share questionnaires across several courses and I would like to use Imoprt/Export questions to do this. I have the Import/Export option, and it basically works, but when dropdownlist (rated) questions are imported into the new questionnaire, anwers to those questions are not shown in the analysis. They DO show up in the individual responses. I'm not sure which version of the feedback module this is (it wasn't installed by me) -  have I got a feedback module version problem? Also - I will be upgrading to moodle 1.9 in June - can you please recommend to me which version of feedback I should upgrade to, and when - before or after moodle upgrade? (I'd really appreciate some advice, as when we upgraded to 1.6 to 1.8 last summer,  we had a problem when questionnaire results were anonymised - I now see from the forum I wasn't the only one who had this problem!) Thanks, hope you can help!
Comment 3: Hi Mike, you should use the last feedback-version for 1.8 (2007102701). If you are plannig an upgrade to 1.9 so you can upgrade the feedback-module only after that upgrade. The current feedback for 1.9 only runs on moodle 1.9 or later. Best regards Andreas

Forum Post: 
Post title: Feedback permissions - bug or wrongly configured?
Post description: Hi, I've set up a feedback in 1.9 on the front page . The default role on the front page is 'student' and teachers are all given the 'course creator' role via LDAP . I want the feedback to only be available to staff, so I have gone to 'role overrides' and have set 'view feedback' and complete feedback' for students and authenticated users to 'prohibit'. Now, when I log in as a student, I have no problem viewing the feedback questions, but I was expecting a permissions error. Am I doing this right, or is there an issue with the permissions code in the feedback module? Matt
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: fixed it. All course creators had the permission to alter feedbacks by default so I used a role override to prevent them from doing anything but view and complete
Comment 2: Hi Matt, thank you for your post. In the feedback for 1.9/2.0 it will be the default setting.

Post title: Feedback not giving link to questions when non-anonymous
Post description: I am using Moodle 1.8.2 and downloaded the latest Feedback for 1.9 today and loaded it to my site (to see if this problem would go away). When I set up a feedback on the main page, then create a block in the relevant course to see the feedback, I get the following: 1) The link to the questions does not display below the intro text when I click on the feedback in the block (in the course) if the feedback is set up to store the user name and info 2) The link to the questions does display if I set the Feedback up to allow anonymous user entries. I allow multiple entries. How can I overcome this? Thanks Mariana
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I have now upgraded to Moodle 1.8.3 in the hope that this will solve the problem, but it is the same. The problem is: 1) Logged in users do not get the "Answer the questions" link if they click on a feedback in the feedback block that is set to capture the name of the user. They do get that link if they are not logged in. This means that I can only use the feedback module with the "Anonymous" setting for logged in users - it makes no sense to me. Does anybody else experience this problem? Regards Mariana
Comment 2: Hi Mariana! I was having the same problem and apparently found a solution. In order to get identified answers you will need to set roles on the first page, which, for Moodle, is also a course. I set everybody as student and it worked. The new problem is that new members will only be able to answer after you define their role.

Post description: Hi really like the Feedback module. Ideal for for my needs - so thank you for all the hard work in providing this great plugin. I have a question however - I am running moodle 1.5.x and have set up a test feedback., It does not appear to be linkiing to my Glossary however. Glossary AutoLinking would be my natural choice - however it does not seem to work within Feedback Surveys. Am I doing something wrong or is this a known issue? In either case - does anyone know what I need to do to enable Glossary Autolinking within Feedback? Thanks - QuaySupport

Post title: Language mixture in Feedback
Post description: Hello! My Moodle-site is normally in German. Now I created an English course (set English as course default language). All navigation elements show up correctly in English, except Feedback. If I access a Feedback, I see the German link "Formular ausfüllen" instead of "Answer the questions..." As trainer I get some similar behaviour in edit mode of a Feedback. If "overview" is open, all Feedback menu entries are in German (Übersicht, Elemente bearbeiten, Vorlagen ...). After selecting "Elemente bearbeiten", the menu turns into English (then I see overview, edit questions, templates ...) The lang-files of Feedback are stored in moodledata/lang/de_utf8_local and moodledata/lang/en_urf8_local. My Moodle is currently at version 1.8.2, Feedback version for Moodle 1.9. Regards, Daniel
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Daniel, please try to copy your standard german feedback files to: moodledata/lang/de_utf8 and the english files to moodle/lang/en_utf8 Its possible that the problem happens from a feedback.php only in your local folders.
Comment 2: Hello Ralf! I copied my Feedback-langfiles to en_utf8 and de_utf8, but that does not change anything. For testing I tried another setting: I changed my browser language to French, that gaves me in Feedback entry page not the German link "Formular ausfüllen", but instead the French link "Remplir le questionaire..." As Trainer it's the same like before, in edit mode first page has German menu entries, clicking on "Elemente hinzufügen" results in correct English menu entries. The French browser setting has no influence on that. Regards, Daniel
Comment 3: Hi Daniel what ralf was meaning are the different places of the folders en_utf8 and de_utf8. de_utf8 is placed in your <moodledata>/lang en_utf8 is placed in your <moodledir>/lang If you copied the en_utf8 to moodledata/lang so I would think the files will not be found. Andreas
Comment 4: Hello Andreas! What I did after Ralfs' post was: Copy the Feedback-langfiles into /moodle/lang/en_utf8 and /moodledata/lang/de_utf8. But this didn't changed anything. Do I have also to delete the Feedback-langfiles in /moodledata/lang/en_utf8_local and /moodledata/lang/de_utf8_local? Regards, Daniel
Comment 5: Hi Daniel, now I have seen it. This behavior does occur if the feedback is anonymous. I have to fix that. Thank you! Andreas
Comment 6: Hello Andreas! That's good news! Thanks for your great work with the Feedback module! Small questions regarding non-anonymous feedbacks: I do mostly use anonymous Feedbacks, because the entries from the same person are not overwritten. (they have to enter their names instead). I'd really like to use non-anonymous Feedbacks if (as written in the help files) Feedbacks from the same person are not overwritten. Today I got an email from a new entry in one of my anonymous Feedbacks. The person who sent the Feedback was logged in into my Moodle-system. The email showed me as sender the mail address of that person, which makes the Feedback non-anonymous I think. Can you change this behavior, maybe as sender by using the system default mail address? Regards, Daniel
Comment 7: Hi Daniel, the current version now seems to be ok with languages. Your problem with email-addresses I can not reproduce. All anonymous answers were sent without the users email-address. Can you check the setting of roles and permissions from your user? Perhaps I did oversee some things. Andreas
Comment 8: Hello Andreas! I'll test your language fixes in a few days. Now about the anonymous Feedback: I tried again, and I could reproduce it. So here you have a detailed description: anonymous Feedback on the front page student Max Meier is logged in student submits the Feedback Me (as admin) gets an Email: mail from: Max Meier mail adress: noreply@mysite.de mail to: admin-mailadress subject: submitted: Max Meier -> myFeedback (original german: Ausgefüllt: Max Meier -> myFeedback) In the mail message itself is also written that Max Meier has submitted a Feedback. If I (as admin) log in and visit the Feedback, there is only written that someone has submitted a Feedback, but not the name of that person. Little hardware background: Currently I'm running Moodle 1.8.2, coming from 1.6.1+ directly to 1.8. I have not changed any roles. I hope you can reproduce this behavior now. Regards, Daniel
Comment 9: Hi Daniel, I'm sorry. I can not reproduce this behavior. Can it be the user Max Meier has some special rights e.g. course-creator or so? Andreas
Comment 10: Hello Andreas! No, my test student Max Meier has no special rights, he is just a student. The original mail about a submitted anonymous Feedback came from one of my teachers. I could see the Email and Name of that teacher. I just tried to reproduce this behavior with my test student, which I could do. I will test this Feedback problem with your latest version of the Feedback module to find an answer. Regards, Daniel
Comment 11: Hello Andreas! I updated my Feedback-version to your latest provided version and after submitting a Feedback by my test student, it was really anonymous (mail from administrator with anonymous Feedback entry notice). The language issue looks very well. There are only 2 small things to fix: in edit mode: first menu point "Overview" missing German translation in edit mode - menu "Einträge anzeigen": button text shows not correct German "ä", instead I see "Einträge anzeigen". Maybe it has to be encoded in unicode. Regards, Daniel

Post title: Feedback block question
Post description: Hello! I am using the Feedback-module for some time now and it works really great. Now I created a new Feedback at my Moodle front-page (not assigned to a special course), and tried to access it by using MyMoodle and the Feedback block. The Feedback shows up correctly inside the Feedback block, but if someone tries to access it, the link points to one of my courses, where no Feedback is available. It seems that the link is not created correctly. If assigning the Feedback to my front-page course, it does not show up in MyMoodle Feedback-Block. Is this a bug or am I doing something wrong? My System: Moodle 1.8.2, Feedback version for 1.9 (downloaded today)
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Daniel, can you explain, what do you mean with "the link points to one of my courses"? The link never should point to any course. Can you tell me the built link (the last part from .../feedback is sufficient)? Andreas
Comment 2: Hello Andreas! I try to explain: If I enable the Feedback block in MyMoodle, my Feedback is listed in the Feedback block. If I click on the link, it opens the Feedback (menu shows already the wrong course), If I then want to complete a feedback, I get get an error message because I don't have access to the selected course. But the point is: This Feedback is placed on the front-page, and not in the course the link points to. Here is the build link out of the Feedback block: .../feedback/view.php?id=922&courseid=44 This is the link to the same Feedback on my front-page: .../feedback/view.php?id=922 Regards, Daniel
Comment 3: Hi Daniel, thank you! Now I understand you. The feedback normaly isn't intended to show up in the moodle My-Site. How ever, now the feedback-block no longer can be added on this site. Viele Grüße aus Berlin Andreas

Forum Post: 
Post title: Exporting to Excel error in Feedback module
Post description: Asked this question before but got no replies so I will try again. When exporting to Excel the text gets cut off. A suggestion on another forum that it was possible xml problem and easy to fix. Dose anyone know how to apply the fix?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Stephen, as I see do you use moodle 1.6.x. The excel-export for that version has some limitations. UTF-8 characters will not be converted. The max length of text is 255. Can you more precisely describe your issue? Andreas
Comment 2: Hi Andreas Yes it is 1.6 and the problem appears to cut off in the text at 255 when exported . Is there a way of extending the text amount? Can the data be exported into 1.7 or 1.8 and this way show the extended text? Stephen
Comment 3: Hi Stephen, currently there is no way to extend the amount of text. I planned an update of this version but I'm not sure when I will have time to do this. You can backup your course and restore it on a moodle 1.7.x or later.
Comment 4: Thanks again Andreas, What I was thinking if I back up the Feedback data from 1.6 and then restore and open it in 1.7 will all of the text then be viewable in Excel?
Comment 5: Yes, that's what I mean. Andreas
Comment 6: Hi Andreas, The attached changes fixed the issue for us. It's basically a couple of files from the 1.7 version modified to work in moodle 1.6. It isn't very pretty, and there are still some character conversion issues, but it seems to do the job. Tested in Moodle 1.6.1 and Excel 2003 and OpenOffice 2.2. Thanks, Paul.
Comment 7: Hi Paul, thank you for your work. Unfortunately the fix only will work on Moodle 1.6.x and not on 1.5.3. I found an excel-lib without pear but not tested yet. It supports utf-8 and values with more than 255 characters like the excel-lib from pear. I'm hoping, that you are not bad. But I don't want to manage an further branch of feedback. Andreas
Comment 8: Hi Andreas, Yes I hadn't looked at moodle 1.5 at all - luckily we are using 1.6 and will probably be upgrading over the summer too, so I hadn't looked in to how it would work on 1.5! Still, it might be useful if anyone else is having issues with moodle 1.6.x anyway. Thanks, Paul.
Comment 9: Please help! We are running 1.7 and have the 1.7 version of the feedback module - and we have the same problem with the excel export cutting all the responses short. We don't understand this answer as the "bug" does not seem to be fixed. Is there anything we can do to retrieve the missing data in the excel file - or export it some other way? Thanks for any help you can give us.
Comment 10: Hi tickner, probably you can do a screen shot of what your problem and post it into this posting so that the rest of us can understand your problem better.
Comment 11: The problem is exactly as Stephen says above - the textual answers are cut short in the excel version of the data. Only the first part of the answer is exported to excel.
Comment 12: Hi, do you use the latest version of the feedback? If yes, what system do you use (Win, Lin, php4/5 and so on)? Andreas
Comment 13: Hi, I am answering this for Sue (Tickner) - see her message above. We are using Moodle version 1.7 and the latest 1.7 version of the feedback module. When exporting the data in Excel format answers that are longer than 255 characters are "cropped", so only the first 255 characters are displayed in Excel. Moodle 1.7 runs on a Windows PHP5 / MySQL 4.1 system. The problem only happens with Excel-export files. Previous posts sound like the 255 character limitation was "fixed" for the 1.7 version of the module. Any hints would be appreciated. Cheers! Anatol
Comment 14: Hi Anatol, sorry, I can not reproduce your problem. I tested it with over 4000 characters on a windows-system with php 5.1.1 and all characters were displayed in excel. Perhaps your excel-version is incompatible. I tested Excel 97/2000/2003. What version do you use? Have you tried to open the xls-File in OpenOffice? Andreas

Post title: Feedback: Some Bug [Course Module ID was incorrect]
Post description: System Setting: Moodle 1.7.2 Here is what happen [1] Feedback is created in Main Menu and mapped to course C1 and C2. [2] Each course has the feedback block activiated. [3] The Main Menu is set to hidden mode so that student cannot go to feedback using Main Menu [4] Now, when a student from course C1 login and select course C1. [5] Student click Feedback inside the feedback block in course C1. [6] There is an error after step [5]. The error is 'Course Module ID was incorrect' (Under the view.php ~ the courseid of C1 is 7 which is reflected correctly) Was wondering what else is causing the problem. Is it the view.php statement problem on (! $cm = get_coursemodule_from_id('feedback', $id)) or the lib.php which is included inside the view.php. Thanks in advance for any help posted in here.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi, if you have downloaded the latest version you have to copy the activity feedback and the block feedback to the right places. The current version of the block feedback is 2007050302 . You can find it under Site Administration -> Modules -> Blocks . Andreas
Comment 2: Thanks Andreas! Thanks for letting me know of the latest block version which is 2007050302 cause when I went to check my server , I notice that I have the 2007050301 version. So "Stupid" of me for not update the block but just the activity feedback. Thanks for your patience and your effort in creating such a wonderful feedback module. But there is one wish-list that I would like to see in the next version of Feedback module. A feedback question that have unique answers for each question. Let me explain further.... suppose a feedback has 3 questions - Q1, Q2 and Q3. So, there will be at least 3 answers - A1, A2 and A3 (and so on) If the student select A1 as the answer for Q1, then the student should NOT be allowed to select A1 for Q2 or Q3. Same goes for A2 and A3. (Each answer can only be displayed ONCE in a question AND there should be more answers than question or else there will be questions without answers). Do hope to see such features in the Feedback module and your comments about this. (Can see my other post on Feedback: New Feedback Question Format for details too) Good Luck in creating such feedback question!

Post title: Delete Old Feedback Responses

Comments associated with the post:

Forum Post: 
Post title: Feedback:  Error when installing in 1.8+
Post description: I have installed Feedback in Moodle 1.8+. I also have zend optimiser installed on the server . When I enter the admin to initialise the tables, I get Fatal error : Cannot clone object of class DOMDocument due to 'zend.ze1_compatibility_mode' in C:\<mydirectories>\ wwwroot \services\lib\xmldb\classes\XMLDBFile.class.php on line 84 Please help. What do I need to do? Thanks Mariana
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Mariana, I don't have any experience with zend-optimizer. Perhaps it is a problem with file-date. Can you try to deactivate zend then install the feedback and then activate zend again. Or to clear the cache of zend. Andreas
Comment 2: Hi Andreas We have now tested it on another domain with zend optimiser (same configuration), and it works fine. So the problem is not with zend optimiser, but rather my specific Moodle. I am using Moodle 1.8+ and my last download was about two days ago. Any idea what it could be? I have also uninstalled the feedback module and removed the row in mdl_block. Then I re-installed, but the problem was still there. Thanks Mariana
Comment 3: Hi Mariana, have you tried to disable zend-optimizer or cleaned the cache of it? Andreas
Comment 4: Hello Andreas I have tried to install a new Moodle now on the domain where I get the error to see if I can repeat the successful installation of Feedback on another domain. In doing so I got the same error (above) while the standard Moodle database tables were created during the install process. So, firstly, sorry, the problem just became visible to me while installing the Feedback module, it has nothing to do with the Feedback module. Yes, I have now again asked my SP to look at the settings / cache etc of zend optimiser, since they did not continue tests when they were able to install Feedback on another domain with the zend optimizer running. Thank you for your responses, much appreciated - but the problem has nothing to do with Feedback after all. Sorry for that. Regards Mariana
Comment 5: In case someone else finds the same problem, we have found the solution: In php.ini the variable zend.ze1_compatibility_mode must be OFF. My setting was ON, and it caused the problem. Mariana

Forum Post: 
Post title: Feedback: add_to_log patch
Post description: Andreas, With the patches I sent you, we began giving course evaluations. One problem that came up was teachers could not view which students submitted even though the data was in the mdl_log table. This was because the cmid (course module id) was not being added. To correct this I changed line 118 of the /mod/feedback/complete.php file from: add_to_log($course->id, "feedback", "submit", "view.php?id=$cm->id", "$feedback->name"); to: add_to_log($course->id, "feedback", "submit", "view.php?id=$cm->id", "$feedback->name",$cm->id,$userid); This explicitly passes the course module and userid. I was able to use SQL to fill in the cmid since it was being stored in the URL with an UPDATE mdl_log
